description: This is a reading group. In Spring 2025, we are studying semiadditivity. We meet on Fridays at 2:00pm in Harvard SC 309. Open invite.

talks.title: Introduction to Spectral Sequences
talks.description: We introduce the notion of spectral sequences and discuss their applications in computing homology and cohomology groups.

talks.title: The Serre Spectral Sequence
talks.description: An exploration of the Serre spectral sequence and its role in computing the homology of fiber bundles.

talks.title: Applications to Homotopy Theory
talks.description: We discuss applications of spectral sequences to problems in homotopy theory, including computations of homotopy groups of spheres.

talks.title: Cohomology Operations
talks.description: An introduction to cohomology operations and their role in stable homotopy theory. We explore Steenrod squares and their applications.

talks.title: K-Theory and Vector Bundles
talks.description: We study topological K-theory and its relationship with vector bundles over manifolds. Applications to index theory and characteristic classes.

talks.title: Cobordism Theory
talks.description: An exploration of cobordism groups and their computation using spectral sequences. We discuss Thom's theorem and its implications.

talks.title: Characteristic Classes
talks.description: We study Chern classes, Stiefel-Whitney classes, and Pontryagin classes. Applications to classification of vector bundles and manifolds.

talks.title: Fiber Bundles and Fibrations
talks.description: An in-depth look at fiber bundles, principal bundles, and their role in topology. We explore the long exact sequence of a fibration.

talks.title: Homotopy Groups of Spheres
talks.description: Computational techniques for homotopy groups of spheres using spectral sequences. Discussion of stable and unstable homotopy groups.

talks.title: Differential Forms and de Rham Cohomology
talks.description: Connections between differential geometry and algebraic topology. The de Rham theorem and its applications.

talks.title: Atiyah-Singer Index Theorem
talks.description: An introduction to the Atiyah-Singer index theorem and its significance in connecting analysis, geometry, and topology.

talks.title: Elliptic Cohomology
talks.description: We explore elliptic cohomology theories and their relationship with modular forms and string theory.
